paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.types import *
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
from pyspark.ml import Pipeline
from pyspark.ml.classification import DecisionTreeClassifier
from pyspark.ml.feature import VectorAssembler, StringIndexer, VectorIndexer,MinMaxScaler
from pyspark.ml.feature import CountVectorizer
from pyspark.ml import Pipeline
from pyspark.ml.feature import HashingTF, IDF, Tokenizer
from pyspark.ml.classification import LogisticRegression

paragraphs.title: BU CALISMADA KARIYER.COM SITESINDEKI IS ILANLARINDA BELLI 10 KATEGORININ SINIFLANDIRILMASI KONU ALINMISTIR

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
#KULLANACAGIMIZ VERI SETINI KENDI FORMATINDA YUKLUYORUZ, VERI SETINDE :
#1- GENEL NITELIKLI IS TANIMI BASLIGINDA: ILAN SAYFASINDA BULUNAN IS TANIMI VE ARANAN OZELLIKLER YAZMAKTADIR
#2- ILAN BASLIK: ILANIN VERILDIGI BASLIK ADIDIR
#3- LABEL: ILANIN BULUNDUGU KATEGORIDIR
csv = spark.read.csv('/tmp/cleaned_den2.csv', inferSchema=True, header=True)
csv.show()

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
#NULL OLAN BILGILER BURADA SILINMEKTEDIR
df = csv.dropna()

%pyspark
csv.printSchema()

msg.data:
root
 |-- genel_nit_is_tanimi: string (nullable = true)
 |-- ilan_baslik: string (nullable = true)
 |-- label: string (nullable = true)

%pyspark
#BURADA LABEL SUTUNUDA YER ALAN SINIFLARA INDEX NUMARASI VERILIYOR
indexer = StringIndexer(inputCol = "label", outputCol = "labelIdx")
df = indexer.fit(df).transform(df)
df.show()

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
csv.createOrReplaceTempView("ilan")

paragraphs.title: SINIFLARDAKI ORNEK SAYILARI
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT  label,count(label) FROM ilan GROUP BY label

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: OZNITELIK CIKARIMI
paragraphs.text: %pyspark

%pyspark
#OZNITELIK CIKARIMI OLARAK TF-IDF YONTEMI KULLANILDI
hashingTF = HashingTF(inputCol="words", outputCol="rawFeatures", numFeatures=1000)
featurizedData = hashingTF.transform(wordsData)

idf = IDF(inputCol="rawFeatures", outputCol="features")
idfModel = idf.fit(featurizedData)
result = idfModel.transform(featurizedData)
result.show()

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
featured_data = result.select('labelIdx','features')

featured_data.show()

%pyspark
#VERI SETINI BOLUYORUZ
splits = featured_data.randomSplit([0.7, 0.3])
train = splits[0]
test = splits[1]
train_rows = train.count()
test_rows = test.count()
print "Training Rows:", train_rows, " Testing Rows:", test_rows

%pyspark
train = train.withColumnRenamed("labelIdx", "label")
test = test.withColumnRenamed("labelIdx", "label")

paragraphs.title: SINIFLANDIRMA ICIN KLASIK MAKINE OGRENMESI YONTEMLERI
paragraphs.text: %pyspark

%pyspark
#SINIFLANDIRMA-1
dt = DecisionTreeClassifier(labelCol="label", featuresCol="features")
dt_model = dt.fit(train)

%pyspark
prediction = dt_model.transform(test)
predicted = prediction.select("features", "prediction", "label")
predicted.show(100)

%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.evaluation import MulticlassClassificationEvaluator
evaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(predictionCol="prediction")
evaluator.evaluate(predicted)

%pyspark
#SINIFLANDIRMA-2
lr = LogisticRegression(maxIter=20, regParam=0.3, elasticNetParam=0,labelCol="label", featuresCol="features")
lrModel = lr.fit(train)
lr_predictions = lrModel.transform(test)

%pyspark
from pyspark.ml.evaluation import MulticlassClassificationEvaluator
evaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(predictionCol="prediction")
evaluator.evaluate(lr_predictions)

%pyspark
#SINIFLANDIRMA-3
from pyspark.ml.classification import NaiveBayes
nb = NaiveBayes(smoothing=1)
model = nb.fit(train)
predictions = model.transform(test)

%pyspark
evaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(predictionCol="prediction")
evaluator.evaluate(predictions)

%pyspark
#SINIFLANDIRMA-4
from pyspark.ml.classification import RandomForestClassifier
rf = RandomForestClassifier(labelCol="label", \
                            featuresCol="features", \
                            numTrees = 100, \
                            maxDepth = 4, \
                            maxBins = 32)
# Train model with Training Data
rfModel = rf.fit(train)
predictions = rfModel.transform(test)

%pyspark
evaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(predictionCol="prediction")
evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
%pyspark
